WELCOME ABOARD
Feb. 8,1868
NORTHWEST ORIENT AIRLINES

Thank you for
flying Northwest
Airlines
As you fly Northwest, you are flying
with an airline that has experienced
almost half a century of flying over
land and sea
Since 1926, Northwest has ex-
panded from a Minneapolis/Saint
raul-to-Chicago airma carrier to an
international airline leader. North-
west's routes now extend from coast
to coast, Alaska, Hawall, and haltway
around the world to the Orient.
When you fly Northwest, you are
in capable and experienced hands
All of NWA's personnel join me
in saying, "Welcome aboard, and
enjoy your Northwest flight."
Donald W. Nyrop
President
Northwest Orient Airlines
To make
your flight
more
enjoyable
It is our privilege to have you aboard.
sit oack. make vourset comfortable
and we will do our best to provide an
enjoyable flight.
For your convenience
The back of your seat will adjust by
pressing the button on the
arm rest;
you will tina an asnuay there too.
FAA regulations require that seat
backs and seat tables
upright
positions during takeoff and landing.
Within easy reach above your seat
are the reading light switch, air vent,
and stewardess call outton.
rasten vour seat bet
Air turbulence is occasionally en-
countered at jet
flight levels with
little advance warning. seat berts must
be fastened during takeoff and
landing, and FAA regulations require
seat belts to be tastened looser dur
ing the flight.
Check-in time
Passengers are requested to be at the
airport boarding gate at least zu min-
utes before the
scheduled departure
of domestic flights and at least 40
minutes betore the ceoa ture or inter
national flights. Passengers arriving at
the boarding gate less than 10 min-
utes before scheduled departure time
may be refused passage if boarding
will delay the flight.
Carry-on baggage
Baggage carried on board the aircraft
must be placed under the passengers
seat and not exceed 22 x 14 x 9 inches
in size. Garment bags are limited to
two garments
equivalent:
larger
sizes must be checked as baggage.
nternational customs
If you are a U.S. citizen or alien whose
residence is in the U.s..
you are al
lowed an exemption of $100 at retail
value
tou must
have been outside
the us. at least 4o nours and nave
not claimed such an exemption within
30 days.
Non-residents can qualify for the $100
gift exemption it they remain in the
U.S. more
not claimed an exemption within Six
mones.
Be certain to declare everything ac-
quired abroad, including personal ef-
fects which have been worn or used.
Families traveling together may pool
their exemptions
apply on total
value or all articies declared.
Ask your stewardess
Your stewardess is on board to help
you. If you have any questions about
your flight or need assistance of any
kind, call on her.
Pets
Suitably confined, pets may be
shipped in the cargo compartment on
320, 720B, 727, Jet-Prop and freighter
Tients. Contact your Norwest olice
for arrangements.
Reconfirmation
we suggest that you call the reserva-
tions office at the boarding point of
every return or continuing flight and
leave your local telephone number.
Reservations not reconfirmed where
required are subject to cancellation.
Tickets-by-mail
Northwest's tickets-by-mail service is
available in any one of NWA's 36 on-
line cities coast-to-coast.
This plan
enables you to have your tickets de-
ivered by mall as soon as your reset
vations are confirmed.
Portable electronic devices
Some electric devices may interfere
with the arcatts navigation or com-
munication systems. The Federal Avi-
ation Administration has issued a
regulation
stating
No person may
operate, nor may any operator
pilot-in-command of an aircraft allow
the operation or any portabie elec
tronic device on.
. aircraft operated
by an air carrier or commercial op-
This restriction does not apply to (1)
portable voice recorders, (2) hearing
aids, (3) heart pacemakers or, (4) elec-
tric shavers. Dictating machines mav
be used if labeled MIL (Military)
1-16910A, MIL-1-17623 or MIL-1-
61816.
Smoking
Please refrain from smoking when the
"No Smoking" sign is lighted by the
captain. Travelers are asked to smoke
only cigarettes - no cigars or pipes
olease.
Alcoholic beverages
Federal Aviation Agency regulations
provide that no person may drink
alcoholic beverages aboard an airline
flight unless they have been served by
te aire.
properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Gift of David A. Abercrombie in memory of Stanley A. Abercrombie
properties.sfomuseum:description: Inflight information brochure issued by Northwest Orient Airlines, titled "Welcome Aboard"; multipage booklet; white cover with color illustration of aircraft in flight over city; contains information about aircraft fleet, meal service, cargo, with color photographic images and route maps.
